options.name: server
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the deployment parameters that are used for identifying a Micro Integrator server node. You need to update these values when you deploy WSO2 Micro Integrator. The required and optional parameters for this configuration are listed below.

params.name: hostname
params.description: The hostname of the Micro Integrator instance.

params.name: offset
params.description: Port offset allows you to run multiple WSO2 products, multiple instances of a WSO2 product, or multiple WSO2 product clusters on the same server or virtual machine (VM). Port offset defines the number by which all ports defined in the runtime such as the HTTP/S ports will be offset. For example, if the default HTTP port is 9443 and the port offset is 1, the effective HTTP port will be 9444. Therefore, for each additional WSO2 product instance, set the port offset to a unique value so that they can all run on the same server without any port conflicts.

params.name: enable_mtom
params.description: Use this paramater to enable MTOM (Message Transmission Optimization Mechanism) for the product server.

params.name: enable_swa
params.description: Use this paramater to enable SwA (SOAP with Attachments) for the product server. When SwA is enabled, the Micro Integrator will process the files attached to SOAP messages.

options.name: [service_catalog]
options.description: This cofiguration header is required if you want the Micro Integrator to publish integation services to the Service Catalog in the API Publisher. This allows you to generate an API proxy for the integrations deployed in the Micro Integrator.

params.name: apim_host
params.description: The hostname of the API Manager runtime. Be sure to replace {hostname/ip} and {port} with the relevant values.

params.name: enable
params.description: The service catalog client in the Micro Integrator is enabled when this parameter is set to 'true'.

params.name: username
params.description: The user name for signing in to the API Manager runtime.

params.name: password
params.description: The user password for signing in to the API Manager runtime.

options.name: dashboard_config
options.description: This configuration header is required for the Micro Integrator server to connect with the dashboard server.

params.name: dashboard_url
params.description: The URL to access the dashboard server. Be sure to replace {hostname/ip} and {port} with the relevant values from your environment.

params.name: heartbeat_interval
params.description: The time interval (in seconds) between two consecutive heartbeats that are sent from the Micro Integrator to the dashboard server.

params.name: group_id
params.description: The server group to which the Micro Integrator instance belongs. Specify the same group ID in all the Micro Integrator servers that should belong to a single group. By default, a 'group_id' named 'default' is assinged to every Micro Integrator server that connects to the dashboard. When you sign in to the dashboard, you can view data per server group.

params.name: node_id
params.default: A random UUID or the node ID used for cluster coordination.
params.description: The dashboard identifies the Micro Integrator node by this ID. If you have already specified a node ID when you set up the Micro Integrator cluster, the same node ID applies here by default. However, if a node ID is not defined in your clustering configurations, a random uuid is used here by default.

options.name: keystore.primary
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the parameters that connect the Micro Integrator to the primary keystore. This keystore is used for SSL handshaking (when the server communicates with another server) and for encrypting plain text information in configuration files. By default, this keystore is also used for encrypted data in internal datastores, unless you have configured a separate keystore for internal data encryption.

params.name: file_name
params.description: The name of the keystore file that is used for SSL communication and for encrypting/decrypting data in configuration files.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the keystore file.

params.name: password
params.description: The password of the keystore file that is used for SSL communication and for encrypting/decrypting data in configuration files. The keystore password is used when accessing the keys in the keystore.

params.name: alias
params.description: The alias of the public key corresponding to the private key that is included in the keystore. The public key is used for encrypting data in the Micro Integrator server, which only the corresponding private key can decrypt. The public key is embedded in a digital certificate, and this certificate can be shared over the internet by storing it in a separate trust store file.

params.name: key_password
params.description: The password of the private key that is included in the keystore. The private key is used to decrypt the data that has been encrypted using the keystore's public key.

options.name: keystore.internal
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the parameters that connect the Micro Integrator to the keystore used for encrypting/decrypting data in internal data stores. You may sometimes choose to configure a separate keystore for this purpose because the primary keystore needs to renew certificates frequently. However, for encrypting information in internal data stores, the keystore certificates should not be changed frequently because the data that is already encrypted will become unusable every time the certificate changes. Read more about configuring the internal keystore.

params.name: file_name
params.description: The name of the keystore file that is used for data encryption/decryption in internal data stores. By default, the keystore file of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the keystore file. By default, the keystore type of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: password
params.description: The password of the keystore file that is used for data encryption/decryption in internal data stores. This keystore password is used when accessing the keys in the keystore. By default, the keystore password of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: alias
params.description: The alias of the public key corresponding to the private key that is included in the keystore. The public key is used for encrypting data in the Micro Integrator server, which only the corresponding private key can decrypt. The public key is embedded in a digital certificate, and this certificate can be shared over the internet by storing it in a separate trust store file. By default, the alias of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: key_password
params.description: The password of the private key that is included in the keystore. The private key is used to decrypt the data that has been encrypted using the keystore's public key. By default, the public key password of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

options.name: system.parameter
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring system parameters for the server.

params.name: org.wso2.SecureVaultPasswordRegEx
params.description: A regex pattern that specifies the password length and character composition for passwords in a synapse configuration.

options.name: truststore
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the parameters that connect the Micro Integrator to the keystore file (trust store) that is used to store the digital certificates that the server trusts for SSL communication. Read more about configuring the truststore.

params.name: file_name
params.description: The name of the keystore file that is used for storing the trusted digital certificates. The product is shipped with a default trust store (wso2truststore.jks), which contains the self-signed digital certificate of the default keystore.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the keystore file that is used as the trust store.

params.name: password
params.description: The password of the keystore file that is used as the trust store.

params.name: alias
params.description: The alias is the password of the digital certificate (which holds the public key) that is included in the trustore.

options.name: internal_apis.file_user_store
options.description: This configuration header is required for disabling the default file-based user store of the Micro Integrator's Management API. Read more about configuring user stores.

params.name: enable
params.description: Set this paramter to 'false' if you want to disable the default file-based user store. This allows you to use an external user store for user authentication in the Management API.

options.name: [internal_apis.users]
options.description: This configuration header is required for defining the user name and password for the Management API. Reuse this header when you want to add more users. The user credentials are stored in the default file-based user store of the Management API. Read more about configuring user stores.

params.name: user.name
params.description: Enter a user name. Note that this will overwrite the default 'admin' user that is stored in the user store.

params.name: user.password
params.description: Enter a password for the user specified by 'user.name'. Note that this will overwrite the default 'admin' password that is stored in the user store.

options.name: user_store
options.description: This configuration header is required for conencting the Micro Integrator to an external user store.

params.name: type
params.description:
This parameter specifies the type of user store. The following options are available:
  • read_only_ldap: The Micro Integrator connects to a read-only LDAP.
  • read_write_ldap: The Micro Integrator connects to an LDAP with write permissions.
  • database: The Micro Integrator connects to an RDBMS user store.
When you set this parameter, all of the remaining parameters (listed below) are inferred with default values. You can override the defaults by giving specific values to these parameters.

params.name: class
params.description: The implementation class that enables the read-only LDAP user store. If the type parameter is not used, you need to specify a value for this parameter.

params.name: read_only
params.description: Specifies whether or not the user store is read only.

params.name: connection_url
params.description: The URL for connecting to the LDAP. Override the default URL for your setup. If you are connecting over ldaps (secured LDAP), you need to import the certificate of the user store to the truststore (wso2truststore.jks by default). See the instructions on how to add certificates to the truststore.

params.name: connection_name
params.description: The username used to connect to the user store and perform various operations. This user does not need to be an administrator in the user store. However, the user requires permission to read the user list and user attributes, and to perform search operations on the user store. The value you specify is used as the DN (Distinguish Name) attribute of the user who has sufficient permissions to perform operations on users and roles in LDAP.

params.name: connection_password
params.description: Password for the connection user name.

params.name: user_search_base
params.description: The DN of the context or object under which the user entries are stored in the user store. When the user store searches for users, it will start from this location of the directory.

params.name: user_name_attribute
params.description: The attribute used for uniquely identifying a user entry. Users can be authenticated using their email address, UID, etc. The name of the attribute is considered as the username. Note that the email address is considered as a special case in WSO2 products. Read more about using the email address as user name.

params.name: user_name_search_filter
params.description: Filtering criteria used to search for a particular user entry.

params.name: user_name_list_filter
params.description: Filtering criteria for searching user entries in the user store. This query or filter is used when doing search operations on users with different search attributes. According to the default configuration, the search operation only provides the objects created from the person object class.

params.name: read_groups
params.description: This indicates whether groups should be read from the user store. If this is set to 'false', none of the groups in the user store can be read, and the following group configurations are NOT mandatory: 'group_search_base', 'group_name_list_filter', or 'group_name_attribute'.

params.name: group_search_base
params.description: The DN of the context or object under which the group entries are stored in the user store. When the user store searches for groups, it will start from this location of the directory.

params.name: group_name_attribute
params.description: The attribute used for uniquely identifying a group entry. This attribute is to be treated as the group name.

params.name: group_name_search_filter
params.description: The filtering criteria used to search for a particular group entry.

params.name: group_name_list_filter
params.description: The filtering criteria for searching group entries in the user store. This query or filter is used when doing search operations on groups with different search attributes.

params.name: membership_attribute
params.description: Defines the attribute that contains the distinguished names (DN) of user objects that are in a group.

params.name: back_links_enabled
params.description: Defines whether the backlink support is enabled.

params.name: username_java_regex
params.description: The regular expression used by the back-end components for username validation. By default, a length of 3 to 30 allowed for strings with non-empty characters. You can provide ranges of alphabets, numbers, and also ranges of ASCII values in the RegEx properties.

params.name: rolename_java_regex
params.description: The regular expression used by the back-end components for role name validation. By default, a length of 3 to 30 allowed for strings with non-empty characters. You can provide ranges of alphabets, numbers, and also ranges of ASCII values in the RegEx properties.

params.name: password_java_regex
params.description: The regular expression used by the back-end components for password validation. By default, a length of 3 to 30 allowed for strings with non-empty characters. You can provide ranges of alphabets, numbers, and also ranges of ASCII values in the RegEx properties.

params.name: scim_enabled
params.description: The regular expression used by the back-end components for password validation. By default, a length of 3 to 30 allowed for strings with non-empty characters. You can provide ranges of alphabets, numbers, and also ranges of ASCII values in the RegEx properties.

params.name: password_hash_method
params.description: Specifies the password hashing algorithm used for hashing the password before storing in the user store. You can use the SHA digest method (SHA-1, SHA-256), the MD 5 digest method, or plain text passwords.

params.name: multi_attribute_separator
params.description: This parameter is used to define a character to separate multiple attributes. This ensures that it will not appear as part of a claim value. Normally ',' is used to separate multiple attributes, but you can define ',,,', '...', or a similar character sequence.

params.name: max_user_name_list_length
params.description: Controls the number of users listed in the user store. This is useful when you have a large number of users and you don't want to list them all. Setting this property to 0 displays all users. In some user stores, there are policies to limit the number of records that can be returned from the query. Setting the value to 0 will list the maximum results returned by the user store. To increase that value, you need to set it at the user store level. Active directory has the 'MaxPageSize' property with the default value set to 1000.

params.name: max_role_name_list_length
params.description: Controls the number of roles listed in the user store. This is useful when you have a large number of roles and you don't want to list them all. Setting this property to 0 displays all roles. In some user stores, there are policies to limit the number of records that can be returned from the query. Setting the value to 0 will list the maximum results returned by the user store. To increase that value, you need to set it at the user store level. Active directory has the 'MaxPageSize' property with the default value set to 1000.

params.name: user_roles_cache_enabled
params.description: This parameter indicates whether the list of roles for a user should be cached. Set this to 'false' if the user roles are changed by external means and the changes should be instantly reflected in the product instance.

params.name: connection_pooling_enabled
params.description: Define whether LDAP connection pooling is enabled. The connection performance will improve when this parameter is enabled.

params.name: ldap_connection_timeout
params.description: This is the connection timeout period (in milliseconds) when the initial connection is created.

params.name: read_timeout
params.description: The value for this parameter is the read timeout in milliseconds for LDAP operations. If the LDAP provider cannot get an LDAP response within that period, it aborts the read attempt. The integer should be greater than zero. An integer less than or equal to zero means no read timeout is specified, which is equivalent to waiting for the response infinitely until it is received.

params.name: retry_attempts
params.description: Retry the authentication request if a timeout happened.

options.name: [datasource]
options.description: This configuration header is required for connecting to a database from the Micro Integrator. Databases are only required if you are connecting the Micro Integrator to an RDBMS user store.

params.name: id
params.description: The name of the database.

params.name: url
params.description: The connection URL for your database. Note that the URL depends on the type of database you use.

params.name: username
params.description: The user name for connecting to the database.

params.name: password
params.description: The password for connecting to the database.

params.name: driver
params.description: The driver class of your database.

params.name: pool_options.maxActive
params.description: The maximum number of active connections that can be allocated from this pool at the same time. If you set this value too low, the response times for some requests might slow down as they have to wait for connections to get free. A value too high might cause too much memory/resource utilization and the system may slow down or be unresponsive.

params.name: pool_options.maxWait
params.description: Maximum number of milliseconds that the pool waits (when there are no available connections) for a connection to be returned before throwing an exception.

params.name: pool_options.testOnBorrow
params.description: Used to indicate if objects will be validated before being borrowed from the pool. If the object fails to validate, it will be dropped from the pool, and we will attempt to borrow another one.

params.name: pool_options.maxIdle
params.description: The maximum number of connections that can remain idle in the pool, without extra ones being released. Default value is 8. Put a negative value for unlimited. Idle connections are checked periodically (if enabled) and connections that have been idle for longer than minEvictableIdleTimeMillis will be released.

params.name: pool_options.minIdle
params.description: The minimum number of connections that can remain idle in the pool, without extra ones being created. The connection pool can shrink below this number if validation queries fail. Default value is 0.

params.name: pool_options.validationInterval
params.description: This parameter controls how frequently a given validation query is executed (time in milliseconds). The default value is 30000 (30 seconds). That is, if a connection is due for validation, but has been validated previously within this interval, it will not be validated again.

params.name: pool_options.validationQuery
params.description: The SQL query used to validate connections from this pool before returning them to the caller. If specified, this query does not have to return any data, it just can't throw an SQLException. The default value is null. Example values are SELECT 1(mysql), select 1 from dual(oracle), SELECT 1(MS Sql Server).

params.name: pool_options.MaxPermSize
params.description: The memory size allocated for WSO2 Micro Integrator.

params.name: pool_options.removeAbandoned
params.description: If this property is set to 'true', a connection is considered abandoned and eligible for removal if it has been in use for longer than the removeAbandonedTimeout value explained below.

params.name: pool_options.removeAbandonedTimeout
params.description: The time in seconds that should pass before a connection that is in use can be removed. This is the time period after which the connection will be declared abandoned. This value should be set to the longest running query that the applications might have.

params.name: pool_options.logAbandoned
params.description: Set this property to 'true' if you wish to log when the connection was abandoned. If this option is set to 'true', a stack trace is recorded during the dataSource.getConnection call and is printed when a connection is not returned.

params.name: pool_options.initialSize
params.description: The initial number of connections created when the pool is started. Default value is 0.

params.name: pool_options.defaultTransactionIsolation
params.description: The default TransactionIsolation state of connections created by this pool.

params.name: pool_options.validationQueryTimeout
params.description: The timeout in seconds before a connection validation queries fail. This works by calling java.sql.Statement.setQueryTimeout(seconds) on the statement that executes the validationQuery . The pool itself doesn't timeout the query. It is still up to the JDBC driver to enforce query timeouts. A value less than or equal to zero will disable this feature. The default value is -1.

params.name: pool_options.timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis
params.description: The number of milliseconds to sleep between runs of the idle connection validation/cleaner thread. This value should not be set under 1 second. It dictates how often we check for idle, abandoned connections, and how often we validate idle connections. The default value is 5000 (5 seconds).

params.name: pool_options.numTestsPerEvictionRun
params.description: The number of objects to examine during each run of the idle object evictor thread.

params.name: pool_options.minEvictableIdleTimeMillis
params.description: The minimum amount of time an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction. The default value is 60000 (60 seconds).

params.name: pool_options.defaultCatalog
params.description: The default catalog of connections created by this pool.

params.name: pool_options.validatorClassName
params.description: The name of a class that implements the org.apache.tomcat.jdbc.pool.Validator interface and provides a no-arg constructor (may be implicit). If specified, the class will be used to create a Validator instance, which is then used instead of any validation query to validate connections. The default value is null. An example value is com.mycompany.project.SimpleValidator.

params.name: pool_options.connectionProperties
params.description: The connection properties that will be sent to our JDBC driver when establishing new connections. Format of the string must be [propertyName=property;]* NOTE - The 'user' and 'password' properties will be passed explicitly, so they do not need to be included here. The default value is null.

params.name: pool_options.initSQL
params.description: The ability to run a SQL statement exactly once, when the connection is created.

params.name: pool_options.jdbcInterceptors
params.description: Flexible and pluggable interceptors to create any customizations around the pool, the query execution and the result set handling.

params.name: pool_options.abandonWhenPercentageFull
params.description: Connections that have been abandoned (timed out) wont get closed and reported up unless the number of connections in use are above the percentage defined by abandonWhenPercentageFull. The value should be between 0-100. The default value is 0, which implies that connections are eligible for closure as soon as removeAbandonedTimeout has been reached.

params.name: pool_options.maxAge
params.description: Time in milliseconds to keep this connection. When a connection is returned to the pool, the pool will check to see if the now - time-when-connected > maxAge has been reached, and if so, it closes the connection rather than returning it to the pool. The default value is 0, which implies that connections will be left open and no age check will be done upon returning the connection to the pool.

params.name: pool_options.suspectTimeout
params.description: Timeout value in seconds. Default value is 0. Similar to to the removeAbandonedTimeout value but instead of treating the connection as abandoned, and potentially closing the connection, this simply logs the warning if logAbandoned is set to true. If this value is equal or less than 0, no suspect checking will be performed. Suspect checking only takes place if the timeout value is larger than 0 and the connection was not abandoned or if abandon check is disabled. If a connection is suspect a WARN message gets logged and a JMX notification gets sent once.

options.name: management_api.jwt_token_security_handler
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the default JWT token store configurations of the Micro Integrator's Management API. Read more about securing the Management API.

params.name: enable
params.description: Set this paramter to 'false' if you want to disable JWT authentication for the management API.

params.name: token_store_config.max_size
params.description: Number of tokens stored in the in-memory token store. User can increase or decrease this value accordingly.

params.name: token_store_config.clean_up_interval
params.description: Token cleanup will be handled through a seperate thread and the frequency of the token clean up can be configured from this setting. This will clean all the expired and revoked security tokens. The thread will run only when there are tokens in the store. If it is empty, the cleanup thread will automatically stop. Interval is specified in seconds.

params.name: token_store_config.remove_oldest_token_on_overflow
params.description: If set to 'true', this will remove the oldest accessed token when the token store is full. If it is set to 'false', the user should either wait until other tokens expire or increase the token store max size accordingly.

params.name: token_config.expiry
params.description: This configures the expiry time of the token (specified in seconds).

params.name: token_config.size
params.description: Specifies the key size of the token.

options.name: management_api.authorization_handler
options.description: This configuration header is required for disabling authorization for the Micro Integrator's Management API. Authorization only applies when an external user store is used. Read more about securing the Management API.

params.name: enable
params.description: Set this paramter to 'false' if you want to disable authorization for the management API.

options.name: [management_api.authorization_handler.resources]
options.description: This configuration header is required for enabling authorization for additional resources (other than 'users') of the Micro Integrator's Management API. Read more about securing the Management API.

params.name: path
params.description: Use this parameter to specify the resources in the management API for which you want to enable authorization.

options.name: [management_api.cors]
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring CORs for the Management API of the Micro Integrator. Read more about securing the Management API.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Set this paramter to 'false' if you want to disable CORs for the Management API.

params.name: allowed_origins
params.description: Specify the allowed origins. By default '*' indicates that all origins are allowed.

params.name: allowed_headers
params.description: Specify the allowed authorization headers.

options.name: message_builders
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the message builder implementation that is used to build messages that are received by the Micro Integrator in the default non-blocking mode. If you are using the Micro Integrator in blocking mode, see the message builder configurations for blocking mode.

params.name: application_xml
params.description: The message builder implementation that builds messages with the 'application_xml' content type. If required, you can change the default builder class.

params.name: form_urlencoded
params.description: The message builder implementation that builds messages with the 'form_urlencoded' content type. If required, you can change the default builder class.

params.name: multipart_form_data
params.description: The message builder implementation that builds messages with the 'multipart_form_data' content type. If required, you can change the default builder class.

params.name: text_plain
params.description: The message builder implementation that builds messages with the 'text_plain' content type. If required, you can change the default builder class.

params.name: application_json
params.description: The message builder implementation that builds messages with the 'application_json' content type. If required, you can change the default builder class.

params.name: json_badgerfish
params.description: The message builder implementation that builds messages with the 'json_badgerfish' content type. If required, you can change the default builder class.

params.name: text_javascript
params.description: The message builder implementation that builds messages with the 'text_javascript' content type. If required, you can change the default builder class.

params.name: octet_stream
params.description: The message builder implementation that builds messages with the 'octet_stream' content type. If required, you can change the default builder class.

params.name: application_binary
params.description: The message builder implementation that builds messages with the 'application_binary' content type. If required, you can change the default builder class.

options.name: blocking.message_builders
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the message builder implementation that is used to build messages that are received by the Micro Integrator in blocking mode. You can use the same list of parameters that are available for message builders in non-blocking mode.

options.name: message_formatters
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the message formatting implementation that is used for formatting messages that are sent out of the Micro Integrator in non-blocking mode. If you are using the Micro Integrator in blocking mode, see the message formatter configurations for blocking mode.

params.name: application_xml
params.description: The message formating implementation that formats messages with the 'application_xml' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

params.name: form_urlencoded
params.description: The message formating implementation that formats messages with the 'form_urlencoded' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

params.name: multipart_form_data
params.description: The message formating implementation that formats messages with the 'multipart_form_data' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

params.name: text_plain
params.description: The message formating implementation that formats messages with the 'text_plain' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

params.name: application_json
params.description: The message formating implementation that formats messages with the 'application_json' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

params.name: json_badgerfish
params.description: The message formating implementation that formats messages with the 'json_badgerfish' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

params.name: text_javascript
params.description: The message formating implementation that formats messages with the 'text_javascript' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

params.name: octet_stream
params.description: The message formatting implementation that formats messages with the 'octet_stream' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

params.name: application_binary
params.description: The message formating implementation that formats messages with the 'application_binary' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

params.name: text_xml
params.description: The message formating implementation that formats messages with the 'text_xml' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

params.name: soap_xml
params.description: The message formating implementation that formats messages with the 'soap_xml' content type before they are sent out of the Micro Integrator. If required, you can change the default formating class.

options.name: blocking.message_formatters
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the message formatter implementations that are used to format messages that are sent out from the Micro Integrator in blocking mode. You can use the same list of parameters that are available for message formatters in non-blocking mode.

options.name: [custom_message_builders]
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the custom message builder implementation class and the selected content types to which the builder should apply in non-blocking mode. See the instructions on configuring custom message builders and formatters.

params.name: content_type
params.description: The content types to which the custom message builder implementation should apply. You can specify the list of content types as follows: application/json/badgerfish.

params.name: class
params.description: The custom message builder implementation that should apply to the given content types.

options.name: [blocking.custom_message_builders]
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the custom message builder implementation class and the selected content types to which the builder should apply in blocking mode. See the instructions on configuring custom message builders and formatters. You can use the same list of parameters that are available for custom message builders in non-blocking mode.

options.name: [custom_message_formatters]
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the custom message formatter implementation class and the selected content types to which the formatter should apply in non-blocking mode. See the instructions on configuring custom message builders and formatters.

params.name: content_type
params.description: The content types to which the custom message formatter implementation should apply. You can specify the list of content types as follows: application/json/badgerfish.

params.name: class
params.description: The custom message formatter implementation that should apply to the given content types.

options.name: [blocking.custom_message_formatters]
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the custom message formatter implementation class and the selected content types to which the formatter should apply in blocking mode. See the instructions on configuring custom message builders and formatters. You can use the same list of parameters that are available for custom message formatters in non-blocking mode.

options.name: [server.get_request_processor]
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the parameters that specify how special HTTP GET requests (such as '?wsdl', '?policy', etc.) are processed. This is an array-type header, which you can reuse depending on the number of processors you want to enable.

params.name: item
params.description: The item repesents the first parameter in the query string (e.g. ?wsdl), which needs special processing.

params.name: class
params.description: This is the class that implements the org.wso2.carbon.transport.HttpGetRequestProcessor processor. By default, the following two classes are used for handling the two default request items: org.wso2.micro.integrator.transport.handlers.requestprocessors.swagger.format.SwaggerYamlProcessor (for swagger.yaml) and org.wso2.micro.integrator.transport.handlers.requestprocessors.swagger.format.SwaggerYamlProcessor (for swagger.json).

options.name: transport.http
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the parameters that are used for tuning the default HTTP/S passthrough transport of the Micro Integrator in non-blocking mode.

params.name: socket_timeout
params.description: This is the maximum period of inactivity between two consecutive data packets, specified in milliseconds.

params.name: core_worker_pool_size
params.description: The Micro Integrator uses a thread pool executor to create threads and to handle incoming requests. This parameter controls the number of core threads used by the executor pool. If you increase this parameter value, the number of requests received that can be processed by the integrator increases, hence, the throughput also increases. The nature of the integration scenario and the number of concurrent requests received by the integrator are the main factors that helps to determine this parameter.

params.name: max_worker_pool_size
params.description: This is the maximum number of threads in the worker thread pool. Specifying a maximum limit avoids performance degradation that can occur due to context switching. If the specified value is reached, you will see the error 'SYSTEM ALERT - HttpServerWorker threads were in BLOCKED state during last minute'. This can occur due to an extraordinarily high number of requests sent at a time when all the threads in the pool are busy, and the maximum number of threads is already reached.

params.name: worker_pool_queue_length
params.description: This defines the length of the queue that is used to hold runnable tasks to be executed by the worker pool. The thread pool starts queuing jobs when all the existing threads are busy, and the pool has reached the maximum number of threads. The value for this parameter should be -1 to use an unbound queue. If a bound queue is used and the queue gets filled to its capacity, any further attempts to submit jobs fail causing some messages to be dropped by Synapse.

params.name: io_buffer_size
params.description: This is the value of the memory buffer allocated when reading data into the memory from the underlying socket/file channels. You should leave this property set to the default value.

params.name: max_http_connection_per_host_port
params.description: This defines the maximum number of connections allowed per host port.

params.name: preserve_http_user_agent
params.description: If this parameter is set to true, the user-agent HTTP header of messages passing through the integrator is preserved and printed in the outgoing message.

params.name: preserve_http_headers
params.description: This parameter allows you to specify the header field/s of messages passing through the EI that need to be preserved and printed in the outgoing message such as Location, CommonsHTTPTransportSenderKeep-Alive, Date, Server, User-Agent, and Host. For example, http.headers.preserve = Location, Date, Server.

params.name: disable_connection_keepalive
params.description: If this parameter is set to true, the HTTP connections with the back end service are closed soon after the request is served. It is recommended to set this property to false so that the integrator does not have to create a new connection every time it sends a request to a back-end service. However, you may need to close connections after they are used if the back-end service does not provide sufficient support for keep-alive connections.

params.name: listener.port
params.description: The port on which this transport receiver should listen for incoming messages.

params.name: listener.wsdl_epr_prefix
params.description: A URL prefix which will be added to all service EPRs and EPRs in WSDLs etc.

params.name: listener.secured_port
params.description: The secured port on which this transport receiver should listen for incoming messages.

params.name: listener.keystore.file_name
params.description: The path to the keystore file that is used for securing the HTTP passthrough connection. By default, the keystore file of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: listener.keystore.type
params.description: The type of the keystore file. By default, the keystore type of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: listener.keystore.password
params.description: The password of the keystore file that is used for securing the HTTP passthrough connection. This keystore password is used when accessing the keys in the keystore. By default, the keystore password of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: listener.keystore.key_password
params.description: The password of the private key that is used for securing the HTTP passthrough connection. This keystore password is used when accessing the keys in the keystore. By default, the keystore password of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: listener.truststore.file_name
params.description: The path to the keystore file that is used for storing the trusted digital certificates. By default, the product's trust store is configured for this purpose.

params.name: listener.truststore.type
params.description: The type of the keystore file that is used as the trust store. By default, the product's trust store is configured for this purpose.

params.name: listener.truststore.password
params.description: The password of the keystore file that is used as the trust store. By default, the product's trust store is configured for this purpose.

params.name: sender.warn_on_http_500
params.description: If the outgoing messages should be sent through an HTTP proxy server, use this parameter to specify the target proxy.

params.name: sender.proxy_host
params.description: If the outgoing messages should be sent through an HTTP proxy server, use this parameter to specify the target proxy.

params.name: sender.proxy_port
params.description: The port through which the target proxy (specified by the 'sender.proxy_port' parameter) accepts HTTP traffic.

params.name: sender.secured_proxy_host
params.description: If the outgoing messages should be sent through an HTTPS proxy server, use this parameter to specify the target proxy.

params.name: sender.secured_proxy_port
params.description: The port through which the target proxy (specified by the 'sender.secured_proxy_port' parameter) accepts HTTPS traffic.

params.name: sender.non_proxy_hosts
params.description: The list of hosts to which the HTTP traffic should be sent directly without going through the proxy. When trying to add multiple hostnames along with an asterisk in order to define a set of sub-domains for non-proxy hosts, you need to add a period before the asterisk when configuring proxy server.

params.name: sender.hostname_verifier
params.description: The list of hosts to which the HTTP traffic should be sent directly without going through the proxy. When trying to add multiple hostnames along with an asterisk in order to define a set of sub-domains for non-proxy hosts, you need to add a period before the asterisk when configuring proxy server.

params.name: sender.keystore.file_name
params.description: The path to the keystore file that is used for securing the HTTP passthrough connection. By default, the keystore file of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: sender.keystore.type
params.description: The type of the keystore file. By default, the keystore type of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: sender.keystore.password
params.description: The password of the keystore file that is used for securing the HTTP passthrough connection. This keystore password is used when accessing the keys in the keystore. By default, the keystore password of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: sender.keystore.key_password
params.description: The password of the private key that is used for securing the HTTP passthrough connection. This keystore password is used when accessing the keys in the keystore. By default, the keystore password of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: sender.truststore.file_name
params.description: The path to the keystore file that is used for storing the trusted digital certificates. By default, the product's trust store is configured for this purpose.

params.name: sender.truststore.type
params.description: The type of the keystore file that is used as the trust store. By default, the product's trust store is configured for this purpose.

params.name: sender.truststore.password
params.description: The password of the keystore file that is used as the trust store. By default, the product's trust store is configured for this purpose.

params.name: enable_message_size_validation
params.description: If this property is enabled and the payload exceeds the size specified by the 'max_message_size_bytes' property, the Micro Integrator will discontinue reading the input stream. This will prevent out-of-memory issues.

params.name: max_message_size_bytes
params.description: If the size of the payload exceeds this value, the Micro Integrator will discontinue reading the input stream. Only applicable if the ‘enable_message_size_validation’ property is enabled.

params.name: max_open_connections
params.description: This property allows connection throttling to restrict the number of simultaneously opened connections. That is, simultaneously opened incoming connections will be restricted by the specified value. To disable throttling, delete the ‘max_open_connections’ setting or set it to -1.

params.name: force_xml_validation
params.description: This property validates badly formed XML messages by building the whole XML document. This validation ensures that erroneous XML messages will trigger the fault sequence in the Micro Integrator.

params.name: force_json_validation
params.description: This property validates JSON messages by parsing the input message. This validation ensures that erroneous JSON messages will trigger the fault sequence in the Micro Integrator.

options.name: transport.blocking.http
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the parameters that are used for configuring the default HTTP/S passthrough transport in blocking mode.

params.name: listener.enable
params.description: This parameter is used for enabling the HTTP passthrough transport listener in blocking mode.

params.name: listener.port
params.description: The port on which this transport receiver should listen for incoming messages.

params.name: sender.enabled
params.description: This parameter is used for enabling the HTTP passthrough transport sender in blocking mode.

params.name: sender.enable_client_caching
params.description: This parameter is used to specify whether the HTTP client should save cache entries and the cached responses in the JVM memory or not.

params.name: sender.transfer_encoding
params.description: This parameter enables you to specify whether the data sent should be chunked. It can be used instead of the Content-Length header if you want to upload data without having to know the amount of data to be uploaded in advance.

params.name: sender.default_connections_per_host
params.description: The maximum number of connections that will be created per host server by the client. If the backend server is slow, the connections in use at a given time will take a long time to be released and added back to the connection pool. As a result, connections may not be available for some requests. In such situations, it is recommended to increase the value for this parameter.

params.name: sender.omit_soap12_action
params.description: If following is set to 'true', optional action part of the Content-Type will not be added to the SOAP 1.2 messages.

params.name: sender.so_timeout
params.description: If following is set to 'true', optional action part of the Content-Type will not be added to the SOAP 1.2 messages.

params.name: sender.proxy_host
params.description: If the outgoing messages should be sent through an HTTP proxy server (in blocking mode), use this parameter to specify the target proxy.

params.name: sender.proxy_port
params.description: The port through which the target proxy (specified by the 'sender.proxy_host' parameter) accepts HTTP traffic (in blocking mode).

params.name: sender.secured_proxy_host
params.description: If the outgoing messages should be sent through an HTTPS proxy server (in blocking mode), use this parameter to specify the target proxy.

params.name: sender.secured_proxy_port
params.description: The port through which the target proxy (specified by the 'sender.secured_proxy_host' parameter) accepts HTTPS traffic (in blocking mode).

options.name: [transport.http.proxy_profile]
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring HTTP proxy profiles when you use multiple proxy servers to route messages to different endpoints.

params.name: target_hosts
params.description: A host name or a comma-separated list of host names for a target endpoint. Host names can be specified as regular expressions that match a pattern. When asterisks (*) is specified as the target hostname, it will match all the hosts in the profile.

params.name: proxy_host
params.description: The host name of the proxy server.

params.name: proxy_port
params.description: The port number of the proxy server.

params.name: proxy_username
params.description: The password for authenticating the proxy server.

params.name: bypass_hosts
params.description: A host name or a comma-separated list of host names that should not be sent via the proxy server. For example, if you want all requests sent to *.sample.com to be sent via a proxy server, while you need to directly send requests to hello.sample.com (without going through the proxy server), you can add hello.sample.com as a bypass host name.

options.name: [transport.http.secured_proxy_profile]
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring secured HTTP proxy profiles when you use multiple (secured) proxy servers to route messages to different endpoints.

params.name: target_hosts
params.description: A host name or a comma-separated list of host names for a target endpoint. Host names can be specified as regular expressions that match a pattern. When asterisks (*) is specified as the target hostname, it will match all the hosts in the profile.

params.name: proxy_host
params.description: The host name of the proxy server.

params.name: proxy_port
params.description: The port number of the proxy server.

params.name: proxy_username
params.description: The password for authenticating the proxy server.

params.name: proxy_password
params.description: The password for authenticating the proxy server.

params.name: bypass_hosts
params.description: A host name or a comma-separated list of host names that should not be sent via the proxy server. For example, if you want all requests sent to *.sample.com to be sent via a proxy server, while you need to directly send requests to hello.sample.com (without going through the proxy server), you can add hello.sample.com as a bypass host name.

options.name: transport.vfs
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring how the Micro Integrator communicates through the VFS transport.

params.name: listener.enabled
params.description: The parameter for enabling the VFS transport listener.

params.name: listener.keystore.file_name
params.description: The path to the keystore file that is used for securing a VFS connection. By default, the keystore file of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: listener.keystore.type
params.description: The type of the keystore file. By default, the keystore type of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: listener.keystore.password
params.description: The password of the keystore file that is used for securing a VFS connection. This keystore password is used when accessing the keys in the keystore. By default, the keystore password of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: listener.keystore.alias
params.description: The alias of the public key corresponding to the private key that is included in the keystore. The public key is used for encrypting data in the Micro Integrator server, which only the corresponding private key can decrypt. The public key is embedded in a digital certificate, and this certificate can be shared over the internet by storing it in a separate trust store file. By default, the alias of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: listener.keystore.key_password
params.description: The password of the private key that is included in the keystore. The private key is used to decrypt the data that has been encrypted using the keystore's public key. By default, the public key password of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: sender.enabled
params.description: The parameter for enabling the VFS transport sender.

options.name: [transport.http.secured_proxy_profile]
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the MailTo transport listener implementation of the Micro Integrator in non-blocking mode. Note that the list of parameters given below can be used for the non-blocking transport listener as well as the blocking transport listener.

params.name: listener.enabled
params.description: The parameter for enabling the VFS transport listener.

params.name: listener.keystore.file_name
params.description: The path to the keystore file that is used for securing a VFS connection. By default, the keystore file of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: listener.keystore.type
params.description: The type of the keystore file. By default, the keystore type of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: listener.keystore.password
params.description: The password of the keystore file that is used for securing a VFS connection. This keystore password is used when accessing the keys in the keystore. By default, the keystore password of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: listener.keystore.alias
params.description: The alias of the public key corresponding to the private key that is included in the keystore. The public key is used for encrypting data in the Micro Integrator server, which only the corresponding private key can decrypt. The public key is embedded in a digital certificate, and this certificate can be shared over the internet by storing it in a separate trust store file. By default, the alias of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: listener.keystore.key_password
params.description: The password of the private key that is included in the keystore. The private key is used to decrypt the data that has been encrypted using the keystore's public key. By default, the public key password of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.description: The parameter for enabling the VFS transport sender.

options.name: transport.mail.listener
options.description: This configuration header is required for configuring the MailTo transport listener implementation of the Micro Integrator in non-blocking mode. Note that the list of parameters given below can be used for the non-blocking transport listener as well as the blocking transport listener.

params.name: enabled
params.description: The parameter for enabling the MAIL transport listener in the Micro Integrator.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the transport receiver.

options.name: transport.blocking.mail.listener
options.description: This configuration header groups the parameters that are used to configure the MailTo transport listener in blocking mode. You can use the same list of parameters that are available for the non-blocking mail sender.

options.name: [transport.mail.sender]
options.description: This configuration header groups the parameters that are used to configure the MailTo transport sender implementation of the Micro Integrator in non-blocking mode. Note that the list of parameters given below can be used for the non-blocking transport sender as well as the blocking transport sender.

params.name: name
params.description: The parameter for enabling the MAIL transport sender in the Micro Integrator.

params.name: parameter.hostname
params.description: The mail server that serves outgoing mails from the Micro Integrator.

params.name: parameter.port
params.description: The port of the mail server.

params.name: parameter.enable_tls
params.description: This parameter specifies whether TLS is enabled for the MailTo transport.

params.name: parameter.username
params.description: The user name of the email account (mail sender). Note that in some email service providers, the user name is the same as the email address specified for 'parameter.from'.

params.name: parameter.password
params.description: The password of the email account (mail sender).

params.name: parameter.from
params.description: The email address from which mails will be sent.

options.name: [transport.blocking.mail.sender]
options.description: This configuration header groups the parameters that are used to configure the MailTo transport sender in blocking mode. You can use the same list of parameters that are available for the non-blocking mail sender.

options.name: [transport.jms.listener]
options.description: This configuration header groups the parameters that are used to configure the JMS transport listener implementation of the Micro Integrator in non-blocking mode. Note that the list of parameters given below can be used for the non-blocking transport listener as well as the blocking transport listener.

params.name: name
params.description: The user-defined name of the JMS listener.

params.name: parameter.initial_naming_factory
params.description: JNDI initial context factory class. The class must implement the java.naming.spi.InitialContextFactory interface.

params.name: parameter.provider_url
params.description: URL of the JNDI provider.

params.name: parameter.connection_factory_name
params.description: The JNDI name of the connection factory.

params.name: parameter.cache_level
params.description: The cache level that should apply when JMS objects startup. When the Micro Integrator produces JMS messages, you need to specify this cache level in the deployment.toml file. If the Micro Integrator works as JMS listener, you need to specify the JMS cache level in the proxy service. See the list of service-level JMS parameters.

params.name: parameter.naming_security_principal
params.description: The JNDI Username.

params.name: parameter.naming_security_credential
params.description: The JNDI password.

params.name: parameter.transactionality
params.description: Preferred mode of transactionality. Note that JMS transactions only works with either the Callout mediator or the Call mediator in blocking mode.

params.name: parameter.transaction_jndi_name
params.description: JNDI name to be used to require user transaction.

params.name: parameter.cache_user_transaction
params.description: Specifies whether or not caching should be enabled for user transactions.

params.name: parameter.session_transaction
params.description: Specifies whether or not the JMS session should be transacted.

params.name: parameter.session_acknowledgement
params.description: JMS session acknowledgment mode.

params.name: parameter.jms_spec_version
params.description: JMS API version.

params.name: parameter.username
params.description: The JMS connection username.

params.name: parameter.password
params.description: The JMS connection password.

params.name: parameter.destination
params.description: The JNDI name of the destination.

params.name: parameter.destination_type
params.description: The type of the destination.

params.name: parameter.message_selector
params.description: The message selector implementation.

params.name: parameter.subscription_durable
params.description: Specifies whether or not the connection factory is subscription durable.

params.name: parameter.durable_subscriber_client_id
params.description: The ClientId parameter when using durable subscriptions.

params.name: parameter.durable_subscriber_name
params.description: The name of the durable subscriber.

params.name: parameter.pub_sub_local
params.description: Specifies whether or not the messages should should be published by the same connection in which the messages were received.

params.name: parameter.receive_timeout
params.description: Time to wait for a JMS message during polling. Set this parameter value to a negative integer to wait indefinitely. Set to zero to prevent waiting.

params.name: parameter.concurrent_consumer
params.description: The number of concurrent threads to be started to consume messages when polling.

params.name: parameter.max_concurrent_consumer
params.description: The maximum number of concurrent threads to use during polling.

params.name: parameter.idle_task_limit
params.description: The number of idle runs per thread before it dies out.

params.name: parameter.max_message_per_task
params.description: The maximum number of successful message receipts per thread.

params.name: parameter.initial_reconnection_duration
params.description: The initial reconnection attempts duration in milliseconds.

params.name: parameter.reconnect_progress_factor
params.description: The factor by which the reconnection duration will be increased.

params.name: parameter.max_reconnect_duration
params.description: The maximum reconnection duration in milliseconds.

params.name: parameter.reconnect_interval
params.description: The reconnection interval in milliseconds.

params.name: parameter.max_jsm_connection
params.description: The maximum cached JMS connections in the producer level.

params.name: parameter.max_consumer_error_retrieve_before_delay
params.description: The number of retries on consume errors before sleep delay becomes effective.

params.name: parameter.consume_error_delay
params.description: The sleep delay when a consume error is encountered (in milliseconds).

params.name: parameter.consume_error_progression
params.description: The factor by which the consume error retry sleep will be increased.

options.description: This configuration header groups the parameters used for specifying the JNDI connection factory classes.

params.name: TopicConnectionFactory
params.description: The connection factory URL for connecting to a JMS queue.

params.name: QueueConnectionFactory

options.name: transport.jndi.queue
options.description: This configuration header is used to specify the list of queues that are defined your JMS broker. The JNDI name of the queue, and the actual queue name should be specifed as a key-value pair as follows: jndi_name = queue_name.

params.name: <jndi_queue_name>
params.description: The jndi queue name and the actual queue name as a key-value pair.

options.name: transport.jndi.topic
options.description: This configuration header is used to specify the list of topics that are defined your JMS broker. The JNDI name of the topic, and the actual topic name should be specifed as a key-value pair as follows: jndi_name = topic_name.

params.name: <jndi_topic_name>
params.description: The jndi queue name and the actual topic name as a key-value pair.

options.name: [transport.rabbitmq.listener]
options.description: This configuration header is required if you are configuring WSO2 Micro Integrator to receive messages from a RabbitMQ client. Read more about connecting the Micro Integator with RabbitMQ.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the broker.

params.name: parameter.hostname
params.description: The IP address of the server node.

params.name: parameter.port
params.description: The port on which the RabbitMQ broker can be accessed.

params.name: parameter.username
params.description: The user name for connecting to RabbitMQ broker.

params.name: parameter.password
params.description: The password for connecting to the RabbitMQ broker.

params.name: parameter.connection_factory
params.description: The name of the connection factory.

params.name: parameter.exchange_name
params.description: Name of the RabbitMQ exchange to which the queue is bound. Use this parameter instead of rabbitmq.queue.routing.key, if you need to use the default exchange and publish to a queue.

params.name: parameter.queue_name
params.description: The queue name to send or consume messages. If you do not specify this parameter, you need to specify the rabbitmq.queue.routing.key parameter.

params.name: parameter.queue_auto_ack
params.description: The queue name to send or consume messages. If you do not specify this parameter, you need to specify the rabbitmq.queue.routing.key parameter.

params.name: parameter.consumer_tag
params.description: The client­ generated consumer tag to establish context.

params.name: parameter.channel_consumer_qos
params.description: The consumer qos value. You need to specify this parameter only if the rabbitmq.queue.auto.ack parameter is set to false.

params.name: parameter.durable
params.description: Specifies whether the queue should remain declared even if the broker restarts.

params.name: parameter.queue_exclusive
params.description: Specifies whether the queue should be exclusive or should be consumable by other connections.

params.name: parameter.queue_auto_delete
params.description: Specifies whether to keep the queue even if it is not being consumed anymore.

params.name: parameter.queue_routing_key
params.description: The routing key of the queue.

params.name: parameter.queue_auto_declare
params.description: Specifies whether to create queues if they are not present. However, you should set this parameter only if queues are not declared prior on the broker. Setting this parameter in the publish URL to false improves RabbitMQ transport performance.

params.name: parameter.exchange_auto_declare
params.description: Specifies whether to create exchanges if they are not present. However, you should set this parameter only if exchanges are not declared prior on the broker. Setting this parameter in the publish URL to false improves RabbitMQ transport performance.

params.name: parameter.exchange_type
params.description: The type of the exchange.

params.name: parameter.exchange_durable
params.description: Specifies whether the exchange should remain declared even if the broker restarts.

params.name: parameter.exchange_auto_delete
params.description: Specifies whether to keep the exchange even if it is not bound to any queue anymore.

params.name: parameter.default_destination_type
params.description: The content type of the consumer. </br>Note that if the content type is specified in the message, this parameter does not override the specified content type.

params.name: parameter.retry_interval
params.description: In the case of network failure or broker shut down, the Micro Integrator will attempt to reconnect a number of times (as sepcified by the parameter.retry_count parameter) with an interval (specified by this parameter) between the retry attempts.

params.name: parameter.retry_interval
params.description: In the case of network failure or broker shut down, the Micro Integrator will attempt to reconnect as many times as sepcified by this parameter with an interval (specified by the parameter.retry_interval parameter) between the retry attempts.

params.name: parameter.ssl_enable
params.description: Specifies whether or not SSL is enabled for RabbitMQ connection. If you set this to 'true', be sure to update the keystore and trust store parameters given below.

params.name: parameter.ssl_version
params.description: The SSL versions.

params.name: parameter.keystore_location
params.description: The path to the keystore file that is used for securing a RabbitMQ connection. By default, the keystore file of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: parameter.keystore_type
params.description: The type of the keystore file. By default, the keystore type of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: parameter.keystore_password
params.description: The password of the keystore file that is used for securing a RabbitMQ connection. This keystore password is used when accessing the keys in the keystore. By default, the keystore password of the primary keystore is enabled for this purpose.

params.name: parameter.truststore_location
params.description: The path to the keystore file that is used for storing the trusted digital certificates. By default, the product's trust store is configured for this purpose.

params.name: parameter.truststore_type
params.description: The type of the keystore file that is used as the trust store. By default, the product's trust store is configured for this purpose.

params.name: parameter.truststore_password
params.description: The password of the keystore file that is used as the trust store. By default, the product's trust store is configured for this purpose.

params.description: Set this parameter to 'true' if you want to configure the Micro Integrator to send messages to a RabbitMQ client.

params.description: Name of the RabbitMQ exchange to which the queue is bound. Use this parameter instead of rabbitmq.queue.routing.key, if you need to use the default exchange and publish to a queue.

params.description: The routing key of the queue.

params.name: parameter.reply_to_name

params.name: parameter.queue_delivery_mode
params.description: The delivery mode of the queue. Possible values are Non­-persistent and Persistent.

params.name: parameter.exchange_type
params.description: The type of the exchange.

params.name: parameter.queue_name
params.description: The queue name to send or consume messages. If you do not specify this parameter, you need to specify the rabbitmq.queue.routing.key parameter.

params.name: parameter.queue_durable
params.description: Whether the queue should remain declared even if the broker restarts. The default value is false.

params.name: parameter.queue_exclusive
params.description: Whether the queue should be exclusive or should be consumable by other connections. The default value is false.

params.name: parameter.queue_auto_delete

params.name: parameter.exchange_auto_declare
params.description: Specifies whether to create exchanges if they are not present. However, you should set this parameter only if exchanges are not declared prior on the broker. Setting this parameter in the publish URL to false improves RabbitMQ transport performance.

params.name: parameter.queue_auto_declare
params.description: Specifies whether to create queues if they are not present. However, you should set this parameter only if queues are not declared prior on the broker. Setting this parameter in the publish URL to false improves RabbitMQ transport performance.

params.description: Specifies whether the exchange should remain declared even if the broker restarts.

params.name: parameter.queue_auto_declare
params.description: Whether to keep the queue even if it is not being consumed anymore. The default value is false.

params.name: parameter.exchange_auto_declare
params.description: Whether to create queues if they are not present. However, you should set this parameter only if queues are not declared prior on the broker. Setting this parameter in the publish URL to false improves RabbitMQ transport performance.
